name: Reebok Ragnar Adirondacks
intro:
Reebok Ragnar Relay Adirondacks kicks off in Saratoga Springs where runners are immediately immersed by the beauty of upstate New York. Teams of 12 (or 6) head north and experience views of Saratoga Lake, the Hudson River and simple countryside. At appropriately named Million Dollar Beach (Lake George) runners find a place to sleep (?), relax, swim, and admire the sunset with friends. Lit-up vans, costumes and a billion stars overhead come together to create an unforgettable night run that you can only experience at Ragnar. Special to this race, those who tackle the hardest leg on the course up Tongue Mountain will be rewarded with extra Ragnar bling. On Saturday, the whisper of crisp air fills your lungs as you run through the golden light of Aspen trees and up the southern side of Lake Champlain. Your team will finish like champions at Lake Placid, the home of two Winter Olympic Games. Discover what it means to find your inner wild on Sept. 22-23. Your sore legs won’t last, but your memories will.

GREAT NEWS! All 2017 Reebok Ragnar Relay captains will be receiving complimentary Reebok running shoes!! As a captain, we know you are committed to going the distance and Reebok wants your feedback. Check out our Reebok Shoes page for more info!

Reebok Ragnar Adirondacks is part of the Double Medal Series. Run Reebok Ragnar Cape Cod and Reebok Ragnar Adirondacks, in 2016, and earn the Nor’easter Double Medal.

Race Release and Waiver

As a condition of my participation in the 2015 Ragnar Relay Adirondacks (the “Event”) as a runner, volunteer or otherwise, I hereby covenant not to sue, and agree to release from liability, the Ragnar Relay Series, together with its founders, owners, officers, directors, managers, agents and employees, including but not limited to (a) Ragnar Events LLC, Ragnar Holdings LLC, Dolphin BRE LLC, Dolphin Capital Group LLC, Partnership Capital Growth Investors Direct AIV, LP Partnership Capital, Growth Investors Blocked AIV, LP, White Road Passo Stelvio Fund LLC, Clif White Road Investments, LLC and their respective officers, directors, managers, members, agents and employees; (b) Ragnar Relay race officials and volunteers; and (c) any and all other sponsors, suppliers, agents, independent contractors and other personnel in any way assisting or associated with this Event (collectively “Releasees”).  This Race Release and Waiver (this “Release”)is a contract with legal and binding consequences and it applies to all activities relating to the Event, whether located on the race course, exchanges or other race-related venues.  I have read this Release carefully before signing, and I understand what it means and what I am agreeing to by signing.  In consideration of the acceptance of my application for entry or participation as a volunteer in this Event by one or more Releasees, I hereby freely agree to and make the following additional contractual representations and agreements: 

In consideration of the acceptance of my application for entry or participation as a volunteer in this Event by one or more Releasees, I hereby freely agree to and make the following additional contractual representations and agreements: 

I hereby acknowledge that participation in this speed contest constitutes an extreme test of my physical and mental abilities and carries with it the potential for death, serious injury and/or property loss. I hereby expressly assume all risk of injury and damage and release the State of New York, New York State Department of Transportation and any municipality through which this event passes, from all liability and claims of whatever nature or cause which may occur as a result of my participation in this speed contest.

I further acknowledge that “No person or entity shall have the right to bring an action against the State or municipality or any person employed by the State or municipality who was acting within the scope of his authority, for damages resulting from or in connection with any such race, contest or exhibitions.”

I know that this Event, which takes place both in daylight and at night, is held on open roads and is a potentially hazardous activity.  I voluntarily assume full and complete responsibility for all risks associated with participating in the Event and for any injury or accident that may occur during my participation in this Event, including by way of example and not limitation: (a) illness; (b) traveling to and from the event; (c) falls; (d) collisions with pedestrians, vehicles, other participants, and fixed or moving objects; (e) the effects of weather, including temperature extremes and humidity; (f) traffic accidents; (g) the negligence of myself and/or others, including Releasees; (h) animal attacks; and (i) road conditions, including darkness and surface conditions such as pot holes. 

I am aware of and appreciate all of these risks.  I understand that both vehicle traffic and spectators will be present along the race course and that police protection will not be provided.  I know that the presence of vehicle traffic during the race increases the risk of motor vehicle accidents involving participants, spectators, and/or other vehicles, and that such accidents can result in death or serious injury. 

I, the undersigned participant in the 2015 Ragnar Adirondacks event, acknowledge that the event is scheduled to utilize the Warren County Bikeway for one (1) night expected between the hours of 12:00 pm and 2:00 am. I do herby voluntarily and knowingly assume all risks of accidents or injury and, by these presents, do, for myself, my heirs, my executors, administrators, assigns, or anyone else who may assert or claim on my behalf covenant not to sue, and waive release, and remise and forever discharge, Warren County, New York, its officials, officers, employees, agents and representatives and affiliates of and from any and all claims, actions, causes of actions, suits of any nature whatsoever including, but not limited to, any and all liability for personal injury, death or property damage of any kind both at law and in equity arising out of or in connection with my participation in the event and more particularly, my use of the Warren County Bikeway and/or any adjacent property owned by Warren County during the event.

The undersigned further agrees to hold harmless and indemnify Warren County from and against all personal injury, including death, or loss of or damage to any property while on the Warren County Bikeway or adjacent property owned by Warren County during the event, arising – directly or indirectly – out of or in connection with my participation in the event. This hold harmless and indemnity provision shall include indemnity against all costs, expenses and liabilities incurred in connection with any such injury, loss or damage or in the defense of any claim or claims on account thereof, including reasonable attorney’s fees. The undersigned agrees to abide by any and all rules and regulations imposed by Ragnar Relay Adirondacks 2014 for the event including use of all night time lighting devices and/or other equipment as may be required by Ragnar Relay Adirondacks 2014 during the event and adherence to any and all instructions for use on the Warren County Bikeway as directed by Ragnar Relay Adirondacks 2014.

As a condition of my participation, I agree to abide by all traffic and pedestrian laws and regulations and to follow any and all of Releasees’ safety instructions, including all rules and conditions set forth in the Race Bible, which is available on the Ragnar Relay Series website, www.ragnarrelay.com.  I understand that my failure to do so may result in serious injury or death and may be grounds for my disqualification from this Event. 

I acknowledge that I should not enter and participate in this Event unless I am medically able and properly trained.  I agree to abide by any decision of a race official relative to my ability to safely complete this road race and I further agree that race officials may authorize necessary emergency treatment for me.  

Having read this Release and knowing and assuming these risks, and in consideration of the acceptance of my participation, I hereby for myself, my heirs, my executors, administrators or anyone else who might claim on my behalf (collectively my “Successors”), again covenant not to sue, and FOREVER WAIVE, RELEASE, DISCHARGE, and HOLD HARMLESS Releasees from any and all claims or liability of any kind or nature whatsoever arising out of my participation in this Event, even though such liability may arise out of negligence or carelessness on the part of Releasees. 

In exchange for my being permitted to participate in the Event, and understanding there will be no additional compensation to me, I hereby authorize Ragnar Events LLC, to use my image or likeness for race promotional purposes.  I understand the race registration fees are nonrefundable.  I have read the Race Bible and agree to abide by the rules and conditions contained therein.

I acknowledge and agree, for myself and my Successors, that the above representations are contractually binding, and are not mere recitals, and that should I or my Successors assert a claim contrary to what I have agreed to in this Release, the claiming party shall be liable for the expenses (including legal fees) incurred by the Releasees in defending such claim. This Release may not be modified orally, and a waiver or modification of any provision shall not be construed as a waiver or modification of any other provision herein or as consent to any subsequent waiver or modification. I consent to the release by any third party to Releasees and their insurance carriers of my name and medical information that may relate to any injury or death I may suffer arising from my participation in the Event. Every term and provision of this Release is intended to be severable. If any one or more of them is found to be unenforceable or invalid, that shall not affect the other terms and provisions, which shall remain binding and enforceable.
charity:
Ragnar Adirondacks is just around the corner. Make the weekend even more meaningful by fundraising for a Ragnar charity partner or your favorite charity on everydayhero, the official fundraising platform of Ragnar Relay Series! 

Simply go here (or click on the everydayhero logo above) and choose your favorite charity – it’s that easy!  Your fundraising page will be created and you can start making every step count.

To date, the Ragnar community has fundraised over 1 million dollars so let's keep it going! 

Questions? Email nonprofits@everydayhero.com.

 
 
 
 
                            

 

The Hole In The Wall Gang Camp

We are thrilled that The Hole in the Wall Gang Camp is joining us for Reebok Ragnar Adirondacks in 2016!  Dedicated to providing “a different kind of healing” to seriously ill children and their families throughout the Northeast, free of charge. With 35% of campers coming from Eastern Massachusetts & Cape Cod, it’s a community that celebrates the fun, friendship and spirit of childhood, where every kid can “raise a little hell.”  Ray Shedd, Senior Development Officer of Hole in the Wall Gang Camp, said “the Ragnar experience embodies what Camp is all about – camaraderie, challenge, and a healthy dose of crazy, good fun!

If you ran a Reebok Ragnar Relay in 2015, chances are you saw their 180+ runners, received one of their awesome “buff” headbands and enjoyed their photo-booth at Exchange 30. Their teams raised more than $120,000 during the event, all to support local children and families coping with cancer and other serious illnesses.

Double H Ranch

Run for Team Double H Ranch and receive free entry! (details below)
Experience an Adirondack adventure of a lifetime by running with Double H Ranch for ‘Health and Happiness’ in Ragnar Relay Adirondacks! Your support will help Double H provide programs and year-round support for children and their families living with serious illnesses, completely free of charge! As you make your journey along the 200-mile relay from Saratoga Springs to Lake Placid, this Adirondack experience will include late nights, crazy costumes, unforgettable stories, silly jokes, and conquering challenges together with friends – just like at camp. Around here, laughter and fun is the best medicine!

Through our partnership, Double H Ranch teams raised more than $30,000 and so they are again offering the opportunity to receive free entry to Ragnar Relay Adirondacks when you join the Double H Team in 2016 and add meaning to your run! Learn more about Double H Ranch and how you can and help make stories like this possible. 

The Adirondack Mountain Club (ADK)

The Adirondack Mountain Club (ADK) is a nonprofit organization dedicated to the conservation, preservation, and responsible recreational use of New York State’s Forest Preserve and its other parks, wild lands and waters. Since 1922, ADK has worked hard to protect and care for these wild places. From our program center in Lake Placid to our advocacy office in Albany to our 27 chapters across the state, ADK carries out a balanced approach of outdoor education, environmental activism, and committed stewardship so the places we love are there for all to enjoy for generations to come. You run through the park, we protect it!

travel.name: Hotel Options
travel.content:
Hotel Options

We have partnered with onPeak to provide you with hotel options for your race. Through this partnership, we are able to offer you the most competitive nightly rates at favorable hotels throughout the city and will strive to provide you with a smooth and effortless booking process when making your travel reservations. Book Early with Our Official Lodging Partner for the Best Selection!

Click HERE to view onPeak's special hotel offers for Reebok Ragnar Adirondacks participants! 


 

Van Rental

Need to rent a van? Enterprise can hook you up!

 

Elevated Legs Rental

Turn your van into a recovery station! Our partners Elevated Legs are renting legs for $120 for the whole race - that's $20/person for a van of 6!

For more information check out: http://elevatedlegs.com/rent/ragnar/

*Be sure to rent your legs before Monday, September 19th to ensure delivery before the race!*

GroupLocation.name: Finish Line and Trailer
GroupLocation.description:
Volunteers for this shift will greet incoming runners as they finish the race. You will help keep the finish line grounds clean, refill supplies, hand out medals, manage the flow of traffic (runners and vehicles), tie off full trash bags, replenish trash can liners when needed, and hand out food and water to runners.

Volunteers for this shift will be loading equipment (tents, tables, chairs, fencing, etc.) at the finish line into the Ragnar trailer as it is returned to the finish line from the course. In order to volunteer for this shift, you need to be able to lift 25 to 50lbs. This will be an active and physical shift. reg_system.name: Reebok Ragnar Adirondacks
reg_system.description: Reebok Ragnar Relay Adirondacks kicks off in Saratoga Springs where runners are immediately immersed by the beauty of upstate New York. Teams of 12 (or 6) head north and experience views of Saratoga Lake, the Hudson River and simple countryside. At appropriately named Million Dollar Beach (Lake George) runners find a place to sleep (?), relax, swim, and admire the sunset with friends. Lit-up vans, costumes and a billion stars overhead come together to create an unforgettable night run that you can only experience at Ragnar. Special to this race, those who tackle the hardest leg on the course up Tongue Mountain will be rewarded with extra Ragnar bling. On Saturday, the whisper of crisp air fills your lungs as you run through the golden light of Aspen trees and up the southern side of Lake Champlain. Your team will finish like champions at Lake Placid, the home of two Winter Olympic Games. Discover what it means to find your inner wild on Sept. 22-23. Your sore legs won’t last, but your memories will.
